medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient awoke with severe, sharp, colicky pain that migrated to the RLQ region, accompanied by nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the morning of the visit, characterized by severe, sharp, colicky pain that migrated to the right lower quadrant. This was the first episode of such pain, lasting for an unspecified duration. Nausea and 2 episodes of non-bilious, non-bloody emesis were reported. The patient denies fever, chills, and diarrhea.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents and 1 sibling are healthy, with no family history of cancers or inflammatory bowel disease.
